CONCISE.Definition: giving a lot of information clearly and in a few words

GOSSIP.Definition: casual reports about people's private lives

SCANDALOUS.Definition: causing public feelings of shock and anger

QUIPPED.Definition: said in a clever and humorous way

RUMOUR.Definition: information that is shared among people and might be true

SCANDAL.Definition: events that cause public feelings of shock and anger

VISCOUNT.Definition: a British man of high social rank

SENSATIONALIST.Definition: presenting stories in an exciting and attractive way

BIAS.Definition: the action of supporting a particular side in an unfair way

BREAD AND BUTTER.Definition: what fills most of their pages

SHOCK HORROR.Definition: an expression used when you are pretending to feel very shocked by a piece of news

CONDENSED.Definition: made thicker by removing water, compressed

FRIVOLOUS.Definition: not having any serious purpose, shallow

PUZZLES.Definition: games designed to test knowledge or cleverness

BRAIN TEASERS.Definition: questions or problems that are difficult to answer or solve

ASTROLOGY.Definition: the study of the stars and planets in the belief that they affect the lives of people

AGONY AUNTS.Definition: columns that give advice about personal problems

NOTABLY.Definition: importantly, in a way that deserves attention

SEATBELT.Definition: a belt that protects the people in a car

FINED.Definition: made to pay money as penalty

FINE.Definition: an amount of money paid as penalty for not obeying a law

UNBIASED.Definition: fair, not influenced by personal opinions

BELTLESS.Definition: without having the belt fastened or tied

SENSATIONALISING.Definition: presenting it in a more exciting and attractive way

EXAGGERATED.Definition: represented it as being more important than it really is

SENSATIONALISED.Definition: presented the facts in an exciting and attractive way

EXAGGERATION.Definition: presenting the facts as being more important than they really are

PRYING.Definition: trying to find private or secret facts

DEFUNCT.Definition: out of print, no longer existing

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: statements that they had done it without giving proof

SCOOP.Definition: an exclusive story that nobody else has

SCOOPS.Definition: exclusive stories that nobody else has

THE TIP OF THE ICEBERG.Definition: a small part of a much larger situation

READERSHIP.Definition: the group of people who regularly read them

SIDEBAR.Definition: a short article placed next to the main article

TRANSITION.Definition: change from the old form to the new one

NEWSPAPER STAND.Definition: the place where newspapers and magazines are sold
